projectPurpose: To provide a simple, cross-platform command runner for defining and executing project-specific tasks and commands (recipes), serving as a user-friendly alternative to traditional build tools like make for automation purposes.
mainFeatures: Uses a justfile with make-like syntax
Recipes can accept command line arguments
Can be invoked from any subdirectory
Static error checking and informative error messages
Supports aliases and fuzzy searching of recipes

alternatives.name: Make
mainFeatures: Automates building programs from source files
Uses a Makefile to define rules and dependencies
Tracks file timestamps to determine what needs rebuilding
Can be used for general task automation

alternatives.name: npm scripts
mainFeatures: Can run multiple scripts sequentially or in parallel

alternatives.name: cargo-make
mainFeatures: Rust task runner and build tool
Allows defining tasks as commands, scripts, or Rust code

marketPositioning: Just is a command runner, not a build system, designed to help you save and run project-specific commands efficiently across Linux, macOS, and Windows. It uses a simple justfile with a syntax inspired by make but avoids much of make's complexity and idiosyncrasies, making it easier to define and manage common development tasks. Recipes (commands) can accept arguments, load environment variables from .env files, and be written in any language. just provides specific and informative error messages, performs static checks for errors like unknown recipes or circular dependencies before execution, and can be invoked from any subdirectory of your project. Features like command line completion, recipe listing, aliases, and fuzzy searching enhance the developer experience, making just a convenient and powerful tool for automating project workflows.
